articles.title: Personal Website
articles.contents:
Figure 1: High elevation grasslands in Mukurthi National Park, Western Ghats, India (Photo taken by Vijay Ramesh).



Welcome!
I am a postdoctoral research fellow at the K. Lisa Yang Center for Conservation Bioacoustics, Cornell Lab of Ornithology. My research is focused on understanding how the environment shapes the ecology and behavior of tropical montane birds. My research uses an interdisciplinary and collaborative approach that borrows from conservation bioacoustics, community science, and historical ecology.
email: vr292@cornell.edu

articles.title: People
articles.contents:
.


Vijay Ramesh

Rose Postdoctoral Fellow
K. Lisa Yang Center for Conservation Bioacoustics
Cornell Lab of Ornithology
Visiting Postdoctoral Fellow
Indian Institute of Science Education and Research, Tirupati, India
Download CV

Mentees (current and former)





.


Faizee Ali Khan

Graduate mentee
Indian Institute of Science Education and Research, Tirupati, India
Faizee is co-mentored by Vijay & Dr. VV Robin for his master’s degree. His research investigates the drivers of seasonal elevational migration across bird communities in the Western Ghats.






.


Swathi C S

Graduate mentee
Swathi is co-mentored by Priyanka Hari Haran and is leading a collaborative study that tests the effects of habitat fragmentation on song characteristics of the Malabar Whistling Thrush.






.


Pavithra Sundar

Graduate mentee
Pavithra is testing the acoustic niche partitioning hypothesis across a bird community in the Anamalai hills of the Western Ghats.






.


Vandana Kannan

Wildlife Biologist, Keystone Foundation
Vandana is examining the acoustic ecology of the Grey slender loris.






.


Meghana Srivathsa

Research assistant (2021 - 2023)
Meghana worked on numerous bioacoustics projects across the Anamalai hills of the Western Ghats. These projects involved listening to over 150 hours of audio recordings and manually annotating the presence/absence of every bird species in those recordings.






.


Akshay V Anand

Research assistant (2020 - 2022)Current: Graduate Student, University of Florida
Akshay was a research assistant on a bioacoustics and a historical resurvey project across the Anamalai and the Nilgiri hills of the Western Ghats. He manually annotated acoustic data from the Anamalai hills & carried out extensive fieldwork across the Nilgiri hills.






.


Amrutha Rajan

Research assistant (2020 - 2022)Current: Project Assistant, Keystone Foundation
Amrutha digitized historical land cover data and carrying out fieldwork across the Nilgiris.

Collaborators
I believe that science is a team-effort and none of the work I do would be possible without collaborations and partnerships. Below, I have listed current and former collaborators and mentors (in no particular order):
Priyanka Hari HaranLaurel SymesPratik Rajan GupteVV RobinMorgan W. TingleyRuth S DeFriesDivya MudappaT R Shankar RamanAnita VargheseVA AkshaySahas BarveTarun MenonSarab SethiPooja ChoksiSarika KhanwilkarVijayakumar S PKartik Shanker
Nature Conservation FoundationKeystone FoundationBlack Baza Coffee Co.
